there are services like Direct Connect snow snowball snowmobile which was

the of rolling out your own solution on ec2 or using lambda and you might build

Delta is another product from elemental which provides origination and packaging

so you just create a base set of adaptive bitrate files and then Delta

customers use elastic transcoder for and this is about storage and sharing of
personal video so you take lots of videos on your phone on your tablet you might have videos from decades ago that
you took on handycams Digital SLRs whatever it is and you want to build a service that stores all of
this all of these videos in the cloud and also enables your user to share it with friends and family so those videos
are not stuck on some SD card or some external drive that that's not been touched for years so the challenge here
is you need to be able to handle a wide variety of videos in all kinds of different formats you need to be able to
ingest them they need to be trans they need to be that the user should be able to like share them with friends and
family really really quickly so for example consider the use case where there's a dad who's at a soccer game
with with his kid playing and he's taking a video and he records the video and he can instantly share that with his
wife with his his dad whatever wherever and they should be able to like see it fairly quickly
so the performance and turnaround time is pretty key here and obviously there's large you need to be able to handle
large variations in video volume because depending on the time of day or the day
of the week or around holidays the amount of video that is generated varies
a lot and you need to be able to have your solution scale up and down seamlessly to handle all of this all of
these videos now as I said elastic transcoder has a managed service from AWS and it supports it ingests a wide
variety of input format so you can handle videos from all kinds of devices
in terms of output formats we support a lot of different formats and codecs that
are optimized for web delivery so obviously you have your h.264 mp4 you
then have we also support WebM containers with vp8 vp9 encoding or we
do animated gifs or we have support for wide variety of ABR formats like smooth
HLS - and then one of the key things about elastic transcoder is the ability
to scale seamlessly so on Christmas morning for example when your customers might open a whole bunch of new devices
- taking a lot of videos and you see your videos incoming rate really spike up there's nothing you need to do with
respect to your transcoding workflow you continue to submit the jobs at the increased rate elastic transcoder just
scales up the number of instances in the fleet to handle this increased load and
if you think about other applications that might have similar challenges you have social media videos where again the
key is to provide a really snappy response because you take a video and the primary purpose is to share it immediately as soon as it's taken all
post it off for public consumption then you have digital media platforms and by this this is a pretty wide
and this might cover anything from simple ott platforms which are delivering TV shows for to be consumed
on second-screen devices etc elastic transcoder also supports audio only
processing so that's a great fit for music distribution for delivering radio
on the web and any other audio processing capabilities online learning is another key use case that we see a
lot of so universities that want to get their course catalog online for
consumption by either the general public or by the students so that's that's
another option and then finally we have what I call the video marketing and the
product videos so you might have a site where you want to create a video that's a review of a product or the talks in
detail about a product or it could be a marketing video and all of these elastic
transcoder is a great solution for processing and delivering these videos in terms of a high level workflow you
have your videos from your consumers that's getting into s3 and then you probably have an app that's allowing
them to upload from either the mobile or you might have a desktop app etc or a web interface and then once it hits s3
you might want to think about using a lambda function that fires off an ETS job when of new file lands in the s3
bucket now elastic transcoder allows you to process jobs in in parallel we have
the concept of pipelines pipelines I essentially queues and you can think of
submitting jobs with different priorities into different pipelines so you might so you can sort of you have a
little bit of control over how you want to like manage your incoming videos the
elastic transcoder also offers what we call system presets and essentially a system preset defines is a set of
recommended settings for delivery to a particular platform or a device so if
you if you don't really have a lot of background in video but you want to add a video use case to your application you
don't have to worry about going and figuring out what a go plant is or what the distance between keyframes should be
what and things all right so we have a set of recommended settings and if your if you want to

your application and finally elastic transcoder handles all of the scaling
